publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2674 Mr Jack McConnell: Motion of Condolenceâ€”That the Parliament expresses its deep regret and sadness at the death of His Holiness Pope John Paul II and conveys its sincere condolences to the Vatican City State and the wider Roman Catholic community in Scotland and around the world. Supported by: Mr Jim Wallace*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Tricia Marwick*, Christine Grahame*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Janis Hughes*, Mike Watson*, Irene Oldfather*, Scott Barrie*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Elaine Smith*, Mr John Swinney*, Mark Ballard*, Shona Robison*, Cathy Jamieson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Jackie Baillie*, David McLetchie*, Alex Johnstone*, Bristow Muldoon*, Kate Maclean*, Alex Fergusson*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mary Scanlon*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Bill Butler*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Cathy Peattie*, Michael Matheson*, Murdo Fraser*, Robin Harper*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Murray Tosh*, Fergus Ewing*, Stewart Stevenson*, Brian Adam*, Margaret Mitchell*, Fiona Hyslop*, Gordon Jackson*, Margaret Jamieson*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Michael McMahon*, Bill Aitken*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Alasdair Morgan*, Christine May*, Dennis Canavan*, Hugh Henry*, Bruce Crawford*, Paul Martin*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Richard Baker*, Rob Gibson*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Miss Annabel Goldie*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, John Scott*, Marlyn Glen*, Cathie Craigie*, John Home Robertson*, Eleanor Scott*, Nora Radcliffe*, Bruce McFee*

S2M-2674 Motion of Condolence (lodged on 4 April 2005) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mike Pringle*, Linda Fabiani*, Euan Robson*, Mike Rumbles*, Pauline McNeill*, Donald Gorrie*, Robert Brown*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-2674 Motion of Condolence (lodged on 4 April 2005) Helen Eadie*, Des McNulty*
S2M-2674 Motion of Condolence (lodged on 4 April 2005) Ross Finnie*, Iain Smith*
